We now need the general solution to the second-order homogeneous linear constant-coefficient ordinary differential equation associated with our problem, to give us the freedom to match the initial conditions. The homogeneous equation is:
\(L C \frac{d^2 v_H(t)}{dt^2} + R C \frac{d v_H(t)}{dt} + v_H(t) = 0 \)
All homogeneous linear constant-coefficient ordinary differential equations have solutions of the form \(v_H(t) = Ae^{st}\) because \(\frac{d e^{st}}{dt} = s e^{st}\). If we substitute in this trial solution we get the characteristic equation: a polynomial equation in \(s\).
Since this is second order the polynomial is of the form:
\(s^2 + 2 \alpha s + \omega_0^2 = 0\)
